messages.subject: Re:  NE conference In MA
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 4/28/2003 1:08:21 PM Eastern Standard Time, ... I hated this conference. David Alpert was there, and that was good, but it s overwhelmingly
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 4/28/2003 1:08:21 PM Eastern Standard Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:

> There is one in Boxborough, MA, but it is not considered Unschooling.
> It is on July 18th &19th. It is "2003 New England Homeschool &Family
> Learning Conference"
> Looks like some of it is mixed but mostly Homeschool vendors.
> Just in case someone wanted to go and was not aware of it.
>
>

I hated this conference. David Alpert was there, and that was good, but it's
overwhelmingly BA Christian, even though it claims to be inclusive. The
newsletter put out by the people that run it always seems to have SOMETHING
icky in it.
Kathryn


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: NE conference In MA
messages.msgSnippet: There is one in Boxborough, MA, but it is not considered Unschooling. It is on July 18th & 19th. It is 2003 New England Homeschool & Family Learning
messages.messageBody:
There is one in Boxborough, MA, but it is not considered Unschooling.
It is on July 18th & 19th. It is "2003 New England Homeschool & Family
Learning Conference"
Looks like some of it is mixed but mostly Homeschool vendors.
Just in case someone wanted to go and was not aware of it.

Laura
Maine


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
